meanings.definition: To copy or mimic someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She likes to imitate her favorite singer when she sings in the shower.
meanings.sent2: The child tried to imitate the dance moves of the performers on TV.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to imitate the sound of the doorbell, much to the confusion of visitors.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to imitate the famous actor's voice was surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent5: The comedian could perfectly imitate the mannerisms of different celebrities.

meanings.sent1: The artificial flowers imitate the appearance of real flowers.
meanings.sent2: The artist used special effects to imitate the look of a storm in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The toy car was designed to imitate the sound of a real engine.
meanings.sent4: The designer created a dress that could imitate the movement of waves.
meanings.sent5: The robot was programmed to imitate human emotions through facial expressions.
